shareMutex

Allows both; Lock-Free pure shared lock acquisition via atomic variables; and sleep-wait locking when waiting for an exclusive lock (to acquire or realese)

The mutex has been designed for high shared locks, low exclusive locks contention scenerios.  And has the downside of the possibility of “eternal” shared lock waiting, with continous exclusive locking.  (exclusive locks, takes priority over shared locks acquisition)

Summary
shareMutexAllows both; Lock-Free pure shared lock acquisition via atomic variables; and sleep-wait locking when waiting for an exclusive lock (to acquire or realese)
Variables
_exception_sharedLockOverflow/exception_sharedLockUnderflow/exclusiveLockUnderflow[Static] : Multiple exception variations, for either too many lock or unlock operations
Functions
shareMutexClass constructor, to setup the shareMutex initial boundary bit
has_exclusiveLockChecks for any exclusive locks
has_sharedLockChecks for any shared locks
has_anyLockChecks for any locks
try_sharedLockAttempts to acquire a sharedLock.
sharedLockAttempts and wait till a shared lock is acquired
sharedUnlockUnlocks one shared lock.
try_exclusiveLockAttempts to acquire a exclusiveLock.
exclusiveLockAttempts and wait till an exclusive lock is acquired
exclusiveUnlockUnlocks the current write lock
reload_shareLockRealeses a single read lock, if a write lock was detected : And wait to acquire a new read lock
debug_shareLockCountGets and return the current shareLock count.
debug_exclusiveLockCountGets and return the current exclusiveLock count.

Variables

_exception_sharedLockOverflow/exception_sharedLockUnderflow/exclusiveLockUnderflow

[Static] : Multiple exception variations, for either too many lock or unlock operations

Functions

shareMutex

shareMutex::shareMutex()

Class constructor, to setup the shareMutex initial boundary bit

has_exclusiveLock

bool shareMutex::has_exclusiveLock()

Checks for any exclusive locks

has_sharedLock

bool shareMutex::has_sharedLock()

Checks for any shared locks

has_anyLock

bool shareMutex::has_anyLock()

Checks for any locks

try_sharedLock

bool shareMutex::try_sharedLock()

Attempts to acquire a sharedLock.  Returns false on failure (no waiting)

sharedLock

void shareMutex::sharedLock()

Attempts and wait till a shared lock is acquired

sharedUnlock

void shareMutex::sharedUnlock()

Unlocks one shared lock.

try_exclusiveLock

bool shareMutex::try_exclusiveLock()

Attempts to acquire a exclusiveLock.  Returns false on failure (no waiting)

exclusiveLock

void shareMutex::exclusiveLock()

Attempts and wait till an exclusive lock is acquired

exclusiveUnlock

void shareMutex::exclusiveUnlock()

Unlocks the current write lock

reload_shareLock

bool shareMutex::reload_shareLock()

Realeses a single read lock, if a write lock was detected : And wait to acquire a new read lock

Return true : if read lock was required; false, if no write lock was found

debug_shareLockCount

uint_least16_t shareMutex::debug_shareLockCount()

Gets and return the current shareLock count.  Note that this number is not “reliable” (as any output would not be “live”).  However it is still useful, in debugging during crashes / stalls (detecting phantom locks for example)

debug_exclusiveLockCount

uint_least16_t shareMutex::debug_exclusiveLockCount()

Gets and return the current exclusiveLock count.  Note that this number is not “reliable” (as any output would not be “live”).  However it is still useful, in debugging during crashes / stalls (detecting phantom locks for example)
